turns.speaker: STICKLEY
turns.text: I really do apologize, Mr. Wayne. His project was terminated this morning...

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Let me ask you something, Bruce. What is man's greatest tool?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Why be brutalized by an uncaring world? My RES Box will give Joe Q Public a realm where he is king.  Not that someone like you would need it. Someone so intelligent. Witty. Charming. But for the lonely, the...

turns.speaker: STICKLEY
turns.text: Paranoid? The psychotic?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: ...The Box can change their lives.  Our stock coupons will spike.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Hell. Might even bring old Stickley here a few extra bucks. Huh, Fred?

turns.speaker: STICKLEY
turns.text: Fred?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I'll show you it works.

turns.speaker: STICKLEY
turns.text: What the hell is going on here?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Yo. Charlie. Gimmie an order of brain deep-fry. Extra well done. Hold the neurons.  Patient exhibits symptoms of psycho neural overload. Notation: obviously higher settings can be dangerous to the subject.  Riddle me this, Fred. What is everything to someone and nothing to everyone else? Your mind of course. And now mine pumps with the power of yours.  New from Brain-bok. Da pump. Think faster. Reason higher. Out-cog-nate every homey on the court of life. Da pump. Yeah.  Ho! Mark. I sense an odd penchant for the anagramatic. The acrostic. The crypto-graphic. What doth this bode? Answer me Marcutio, you little runt.  Fred, I must confess you were a wonderful appetizer. Simply divine. But now I yearn for a meal of substance. The main course. A wide and varied palette. Ah, to taste the mind of a hero. A nobleman. A poet.  A chick in a short skirt wouldn't be so bad either.

turns.speaker: STICKLEY
turns.text: ...Fired...your fired...your fired. You understand?! Fired!!

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: _We_ sure are.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: ...You gonna kill me?

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: Might. Might not. Could say we're of two minds on the subject.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: I got family. ...Please.

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: What say we flip for it?

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: ...or death.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Please. I swear I won't say noth-

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: The coin _wants_ to decide.

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: That floor has got to be very hard. Is that better?

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Uh, yeah. Thanks, Mr..uh...Face.

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: Just call us Harvey. Can we get you a sandwich? A soft drink? Given all the trouble we caused you, how about we cut you in for a share of tonight's haul?

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Wait! You said you'd let me go!

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: Never heard of a double-cross?

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: How'd you find us?

turns.speaker: RIDDLER
turns.text: You _are_ Two-Face, you would need to face both rivers, both uptown and downtown simultaneously. Only one spot in Gotham serves these bi- zonal, bi-coastal needs...

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: Congratulations. You get to die on the dean's list.

turns.speaker: RIDDLER
turns.text: Yet so bright and chipper and conservative!  It's so you.  And yet so _you_!  Very few people are both a summer _and_ a winter. But you pull it off nicely.

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: A man with a death wish.

turns.speaker: RIDDLER
turns.text: Harvey. You need me. Since you've gotten out of Arkham, you've managed, what? To bungle stealing a safe? Wreck a statue? And, correct me if I'm wrong here, but weren't you outsmarted by an acned acrobat at the circus?

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: Let's see if you bleed green.

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: Holy shit.

turns.speaker: RIDDLER
turns.text: So not everyone can be a poet. Still, I respect the sentiment.

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: No.  Wait...

turns.speaker: RIDDLER
turns.text: Addictive isn't it? Just Say No. Until I say yes. A little fringe benefit of working with me. Now here's the concept, counselor. Crime. My I.Q., your AK-47. You help me gather production capital so I can produce enough of these  to create an empire that will eclipse Bruce Wayne's forever. And, in return I will help you solve the greatest riddle of all. Who is Batman?

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: Where are you sending Batboy this time?

turns.speaker: RIDDLER
turns.text: Here. Get a good seat.

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: Sure, E = MC squared. Until you factor in more than three dimensions. Then... Damn. Hit us again.

turns.speaker: RIDDLER
turns.text: Haven't you had enough? Don't Think And Drive.

turns.speaker: RIDDLER
turns.text: Not until you do that thing I like.  On se tue pour des mesnonges. J'ai gache ma vie...  Woah. Harsh toke.

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: Don't bogart that 'trode.

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: Oh my God. Jim Morrison was right.

turns.speaker: RIDDLER
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: Everything.

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: Why do we need you? You only come between us. We can be the smartest person in Gotham City. We want the empire for ourselves. Time's up, laughing boy.

turns.speaker: RIDDLER
turns.text: Kill me? Well, alright. Go ahead. Take the empire. All yours.  Hell, Harv, old pals. I'll kill me for you.

turns.speaker: RIDDLER
turns.text: Go ahead. You can say it.

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: You're a genius.

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: We want to dust him. We truly want to dust him bad.

turns.speaker: RIDDLER
turns.text: Oh yes, and certainly _WE_ will!

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: Miss.

turns.speaker: RIDDLER
turns.text: A miss. And my favorite vitamin, I might add.

turns.speaker: TWO-FACE
turns.text: A hit.

turns.speaker: RIDDLER
turns.text: You sunk my battleship.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: How high up would you say that is?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: I'd say about thirty feet, sir.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: You know, if you cut your bathroom in half, you'd have my apartment.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Which bathroom is that, sir?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: The small one.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Alexander Knox. Gotham Globe.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Mr. Wayne is out for the day.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Actually, I wanted to talk to Batman. Pass that on to Mr. Wayne, would you?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Excuse me, sir.  Commissioner Gordon was compelled to leave - -very unexpectedly.  He asked me to convey his regrets.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Thank you, Alfred.  I hope you'll excuse me.  It was a great pleasure meeting you.  And you.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: It's all right, Alfred. Everything's under control.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: ... Very good, sir.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Where's the boy?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Upstairs. He's quite docile.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I know the feeling. It won't last.  He's a long way ahead of where I was at his age.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Respectfully, sir... there'll never be another one like you.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: How long's it been, Alfred? A quarter of a century?  It seems like yesterday. I guess we ended up doing more harm than good.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Don't ever say that, sir. Don't ever believe it.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: If not for you I never would've made it. You know that. My own parents couldn't have...  ... The boy, Alfred. You'll both be provided for. Don't let all this got to waste.

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: Like your boyfriend. He's kinda hot.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Take me. Let the boy go.

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: Gosh, I could kill you, but then you'd miss my party. And you, Batman -- you're the guest of honor!

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: Batman! Don't you even recognize your old pal Jack? After all...  ... You made me what I am today.

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: You know, we should've sat down and had us a little heart-to-heart. I bet we would have got on famously.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: ... Murderer...

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: Bruce, we're both murderers. Think how many people you've killed by letting me live.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: GET IN THE CAR!!

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: WHICH CAR?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Look! Police!

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: I know. I called them.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Shouldn't we --

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: What about the girl?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: He won't kill her. -- GODDAMMIT!

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Can't we --

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Too many people. Come on!  SHIELDS!!

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: How much do you weigh?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: ... A hundred and eight?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: ...Not even a 'thank you'?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Well -- I think you might consider

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: I'll have to ask you for that film.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I just wanted to distract them. I wasn't trying to get a picture of you.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I won't let you have it.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: The Joker is a murderer. And you were as good as dead. So --

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Look, I appreciate what you did for me. But this is my job. And I'm keeping those pictures.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: All right, I'll develop the photos. Anything I don't want is yours.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: How do I know you won't keep them all?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: I'll take you with me.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Thank you, Vicki.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: ... Where are you taking me?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: ... How long have I been out?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Quite a while. I took the scenic route.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Well, I've certainly enjoyed it. -- What's that?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: What is this stuff? Kevlar?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Better. It's not on the market yet.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: It doesn't protect your head, though.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: That's why I wear a target on my chest.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: How'd you find this place?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Exploring. In the woods. Many years ago. -- I was a solitary child.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: They don't come down here. They're afraid of the lights.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I loathe bats.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: So did I, once. But I kept coming back, and... I guess I became the thing I feared most.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: What is that?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Photo database. I'll do your photos now.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: They've got it all wrong. They're watching the warehouses, the loading docks, looking for a tamperer. The Joker is supplying tainted ingredients at the source.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: That can't be right. That would mean every shipment of every product is poisoned. We'd all be dead.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: No. Every product contains one component. The elements react in combination. Hair spray won't do it. But hair spray and perfume and lipstick will.  Untraceable. It's very elegant.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I just can't absorb it all. This place, the equipment. What it must have cost.  Why all the secrecy? Why do you wear the mask?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: I don't want to jeopardize anyone close to me.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: If you don't mind my asking... Who's close to you?

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: Is this what you wanted?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: You could've killed him, you know. You could've killed the Joker.

turns.speaker: BATMAN
turns.text: I had to save you, Vicki. I --  -- Please trust me.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: I assume in my usual charming manner I've just insulted the host.  Alexander Knox.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Bruce Wayne.  -- I've read your work.  I quite like it.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Great.  Give me a grant.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I might consider it if you introduce me to Miss Vale.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: "This is Miss Vale." -- That felt redundant.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: You're just back from Corto Maltese.  I saw your combat photos.  Quite a departure for you.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: That's how it is, chum. One column - and I can bring all this tumbling down. I can take you off the streets for good.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: What is it you want?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: I want you to hang up the suit. And I want you to stay away from Vicki.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I can't do that. Not while the Joker's still at large.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Then stay away from Vicki. That's all I want, man. I just want your word.

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: See, I don't know how it happened... she's a smart girl and you are an extraordinary screwed-up guy... but she's in love with you.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Tell me, Knox. If you've got the story, why haven't you printed it?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Because I...  ... Because she'd never speak to me again.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Do you want a drink?

turns.speaker: KNOX
turns.text: Yeah, a drink. 'Civilized,' right?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Alfred, bring something for Mr. Knox -- I'll have one, too.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I don't... seek publicity -- Will you be staying in Gotham for a while?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: As far as I know.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Good.  With any luck we'll run into each other.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Do you sail?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Too much work.  I'm not really the physical type -- Thank you, Alfred.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Two drinks and I start swinging from the rooftops.  Look, I bore myself silly.  Let's talk about you. How the hell did you wind up in Corto Maltese?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: That's a tough one.  Have you ever seen combat?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Neither had I.  Odd desire for a woman, I guess.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Odd desire for anyone.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Well.  A couple of years ago when their president was requesting aid I went down there for Newsweek. The beaches were nice.  And at nights -- they had a band -- I danced on the hotel patio.  Of course I never saw what was really happening there. When the war broke out I had to go back. And I promised myself that this time... I wouldn't look away.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: What did you see?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: ... Terror.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: There's terror everywhere.  If you train yourself to look for it.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Well, Bruce, some types are a little more obvious than others.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Bruce, really, when I say these things I don't mean to criticize you.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: In other words, what right do I have to talk about terror.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: As much as I do.  It's not that.  I don't want to be depressing, that's all.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I see.  If I know how you really feel, I won't like you as much.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I'm sorry, Bruce, I Just can't seem to get a handle on this conversation.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Vicki, if I say anything cryptic, or... ambiguous, I think you should put the most flattering possible interpretation on it.  Because even if it doesn't sound that way... that's how I'll mean it.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: But it's not fair.  I'm half drunk and you're not even --

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I'll take you home if you'd like.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: God.  You would.  Come on, Bruce.  I just want to get two drinks in you.  As an experiment.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Maybe we should just kiss.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: ... We could try that.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I don't sing very well.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Then there's one thing in the world you don't do very well. And I know what it is -- Now you'll have to kill me.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: To tell you the truth, I'd just about given up waiting.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I said I'd call you the minute I got free.  And I did -- And here we are.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Mm-hmm.  Lunch.  Not even dinner.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: All street mimes should be executed.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: ... Looks like a convention.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I know it's late. I -- Are you there?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Yes, Bruce -- I'm here --

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I'm sorry I had to stand you up today. I'd like to make it up to you.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Well, Bruce -- I don't think -- that would be possible.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I realize... the way things have gone between us...  ... I wish you'd reconsider.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I wish you'd...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Vicki?... This is Batman. I thought I'd call and see how you're doing.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: ... I know it's you, Bruce. I'm not going to talk to you unless we can discuss it...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Who's this 'Bruce'? Are you trying to make me jealous?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I'm serious, Bruce. We have to -- !

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: So we just pretend none of this ever happened. We never met. We --  -- You're going to get yourself killed, Bruce. You know that, don't you?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: No one would miss me.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I don't understand it. You can do so much good for people. As Bruce Wayne.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Money makes money, Vicki. The foundation runs itself -- I'm extraneous to the process.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: You're one man. You can't save everybody.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: What if I could save a handful? -- What if I could save one?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Bruce, at the rate you're going, you can't even save yourself.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Sometimes... I don't know if there's enough of me left to save.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: It's like the last time. He sent me a present before he --

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Very thoughtful. Don't touch it.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: Oh, Bruce. Don't tell me you carry it around with you.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I feel naked without it.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: "It worked for Van Gogh. Let's kiss and make up."

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: The does it. It's going to be this weekend.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Keep her on the line!

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: ... Where are you calling from?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I'm sorry, she hung up. What are --

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Finding out where she is.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: How can you do that if she's already off the line?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I've had an automatic tracer on this number ever since he tracked you to the museum.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Got it!

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: What now?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Hang on. I have to leave a message.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: All this apparatus, Vicki... This house, and the money, and the power ... It was never mine. It was something I inherited. Bruce Wayne was something I inherited.  All I ever hoped for was someone who could see through Bruce -- who could see me -- and not be frightened.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I'm frightened of you, Bruce. I'm frightened for you.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: In all these years... Why couldn't I see how it wold turn out?

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I don't know why I'm doing this. I half wish you'd stay a cripple.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Ohhhh... You don't mean that.

turns.speaker: VICKI
turns.text: I don't, but... I do. It's just... I love you, Bruce. I don't want you to...

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Vicki. Do you love half of me? Or all of me?

turns.speaker: DENT
turns.text: We'll raid the Ace the moment we get a warrant.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: He'll be ready when you do. Remember what happened at the apartment.

turns.speaker: DENT
turns.text: All right, Bruce, what do you suggest?

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: I suggest a nice big bomb.

turns.speaker: DENT
turns.text: Good. A bomb. On a blind tip from Bruce Wayne -- We do have laws.

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Then for God's sake, Harvey, cancel the anniversary celebration.

turns.speaker: DENT
turns.text: We've told him we'll deal. What could he possible have to gain by --

turns.speaker: BRUCE
turns.text: Do you still think the Joker cares about money??

turns.speaker: DENT
turns.text: I don't know. I'm just a D.A. I don't have access to all you expert sources.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: We got 'em!

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: Take 'em! I want his head!

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: SOMEBODY'S KILLED THE POWER!!

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: WHAT?

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: SOMEBODY'S KILLED THE --

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: WHAT??

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Boss! Jesus! They've --

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: They'll be sorry. They'll be sorry. MOVE OUT!

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: MOVE! Can't you do something??

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: It's a detour. They're backed up for blocks!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I missed you, Lieutenant.

turns.speaker: ECKHARDT
turns.text: Sorry.  We had another bat sighting.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't let your job interfere with your business.  -- Someone's been talking to Harvey Dent.

turns.speaker: ECKHARDT
turns.text: I'm on top of it.  If there's a problem --

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Eckhardt... our problems are your problems.

turns.speaker: ECKHARDT
turns.text: I answer to Grissom, punk.  Not to you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why, Eckhardt.  You should be thinking about the future.

turns.speaker: ECKHARDT
turns.text: Got it all figured, huh?  Grissom just sits back and hands you the reins.  -- Maybe he don't know what we know.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: ECKHARDT
turns.text: About how pretty you are, pretty boy.  Maybe he'd like to know --

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Let's beat it, man.  I don't like it up here.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What are you, scared of heights?

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: I dunno, man.  After what happened to Johnny Gobs - -

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Look, Johnny Gobs got ripped and walked off a roof, all right?  No big loss.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: That ain't what I heard.  That ain't what I heard at all.  I heard the bat got him.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Gimme a break, will you?  Shut up.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: Five stories, straight down. There was no blood in the body.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No shit.  It was all over the pavement.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: There was no blood, man.  My brother says... all the bad things you done... they come back and haunt you...

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: God!  How old are you?  There ain't no bat.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: My brother's a priest, man.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No wonder you're such a chickenshit.  Now shut up.  There ain't no bat.

turns.speaker: EDDIE
turns.text: You shouldn'ta turned the gun on that kid, man.  You shouldn'ta --

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Do you want this money or don't you?  Now shut up!  Shut up --

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Okay, a break-in.  Trash the office, make off with the books ... "Industrial espionage."

turns.speaker: GRISSOM
turns.text: Very good idea, Jack.  In fact --  -- I'd like you to handle this operation personally.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why do you need me to handle a simple break-in?

turns.speaker: GRISSOM
turns.text: Because I want someone I can trust.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: GRISSOM
turns.text: Oh, Jack.  -- Don't forget your lucky deck.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's me.  "Sugar Bumps."

turns.speaker: GRISSOM
turns.text: Jack?  Thank God.  I can't believe it's you.  I heard you'd been --

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Is that what you "heard"?

turns.speaker: GRISSOM
turns.text: It's not the girl, Jack.  Sooner or later you would've tried to take me.  You may get me now, but your life won't be worth a dime.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I've died once already.  It wasn't so bad -- In fact I recommend it.

turns.speaker: GRISSOM
turns.text: Jack, listen -- we'll cut a deal --

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: JACK?  JACK?  DO I LOOK LIKE A JACK?

turns.speaker: GRISSOM
turns.text: Jack - - please - - WIPE THAT LUNATIC GRIN OFF YOUR FACE.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: HA!  That's the best part. I CAN'T!!

turns.speaker: ROTELLI
turns.text: I don't like taking orders from Grissom. And I especially don't like taking orders from Grissom's goon.

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: I've considered that possibility.

turns.speaker: ROTELLI
turns.text: And what happens if we say no?

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: Nobody wants a war, Carmine.  If we can't do business, we shake hands and part friends.

turns.speaker: ROTELLI
turns.text: That's it?

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: That's it.

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: Joker here. Can we talk?

turns.speaker: MAYOR
turns.text: I'd like to read a prepared statement. 'While this administration remains vehemently opposed to terrorism in any form, we are prepared to negotiate any reasonable demands which will guarantee the safety of the populace.'

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: Huh. Demands. Well, gents, this is kinda embarrassing, but... I'm having such a swell time, I just haven't thought any up.

turns.speaker: MAYOR
turns.text: All right, then. Here's the deal. Total amnesty... and the sum of ten million dollars, payable in --

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: Ten million dollars. Ten mi -- YOU CHEAPSKATES! I've just wiped out the stock market. I've cost you billions!  I want ten million and one.

turns.speaker: MAYOR
turns.text: Please! We'll talk. Just tell us what you expect.

turns.speaker: JOKER
turns.text: Goddammit, I expect to be treated like and ARTIST. GET OFF MY SCREEN!!
